2.10.3 and other 2.10 releases have it as expected from looking at [our documentation|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF210/Cache+Statistics].

fields.description:
If there is content on the right side of the page, it seems that in IE7 and IE6, the page functions (Tools dropdown, etc) fall behind the content.

It doesn't seem to be all content.  Try jiraissues macro, Deck macro. 

This is a big issue for us since IE is the required browser.

fields.description:
Edit in word opens as read only in Windows 7.

*NOTE*: A fix is now available for Confluence 3.4. Please download the latest version of the Office Connector plugin (1.14) from plugins.atlassian.com: [https://plugins.atlassian.com/server/1.0/download/pluginVersion/30311]
fields.summary: Edit in word read only in Windows 7

fields.description:
Steps to replicate:
   1.  In JIRA 3.13.x, create a pie chart portlet using the JIRA chart plugin. This has to be in 3.13, as you can't make a new portlet in JIRA 4. (request to do so is http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-18521)
   2. Copy the URL into a jiraportlet macro
   3. Upgrade to JIRA 4.0. Make sure you have the right version of the chart plugin, and that it's deployed in <jira-home>/plugins, not <jira-install>/WEB-INF/lib, as plugins need to be in the new location for JIRA 4.
     
Notice that the jiraportlet renders an Internal Server Error.

JIRA Chart plugin is supported, and portlets are supposed to be backwards-compatible in jira.

A proper solution is to use the Gadget rather than the portlet.
fields.summary: jiraportlet does not render Greenhopper portlet in JIRA 4.0

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-18172].
  {panel}

When highlighting a list separated by line breaks, the RTE only makes #1. It should make a new number for each line.

Steps to replicate:
1. Type in a list without numbers or points
2. Switch to RTE
3. Highlight the list and press the numbered list button
fields.summary: RTE should itemize numbered list by line breaks for higlighted text

fields.description:
The gallery macro's sort name functionality does not correctly sort number values preceding a attachment's file name past 9. 

For example, we have the following three attachments: attachment1.jpg, attachment2.jpg, attachment10.jpg. Attachment10 will be displayed in between attachment1 and attachment2 when the page is rendered.
fields.summary: Gallery Macro Sort

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-18170].
  {panel}

A 404 not found error appears, rendered inside what looks like a gadget.

Steps to replicate are a bit tricky:
# In JIRA 3.13.x, create a pie chart portlet using the JIRA chart plugin. This has to be in 3.13, as you can't make a new portlet in JIRA 4. (request to do so is http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-18521)
# Copy the URL into a jiraportlet macro
# Upgrade to JIRA 4.0. Make sure you have the right version of the chart plugin, and that it's deployed in <jira-home>/plugins, not <jira-install>/WEB-INF/lib, as plugins need to be in the new location for JIRA 4.
Notice that the jira portlet renders a gadget looking dashboard with a 404.

JIRA Chart plugin is supported, and portlets are supposed to be backwards-compatible in jira.
fields.summary: JIRA Portlet macro doesn't work with JIRA Charting plugin on JIRA 4.x

fields.description: Confluence should have an account lock out feature where someone who tries to type in a password 5x has their account locked out.  This would make it compliant with ISO standards.

Also trying to insert the an excel file with multiple charts, make the pie charts to show up with a black background, check Black Background.docx attachment for further reference.

fields.description:
I have inserted a table.
In a table cell, I have inserted the following commandline:
{viewfile:STEP Data Quality Product Brief - 2009 ENG-US.pdf|width=400|height=300}
A message pops up telling me that the PDF is being converted. Please refresh after some time.

When I refresh after some time, I end up with a message that an error has occured, and that I should report this issue, with a link to your support site.

I have also tried the same with the following commandline:
{viewfile:STEP Data Quality Product Brief - 2009 ENG-US.pdf}, hence leaving the width and height as default, but that makes no difference.

I think this issue is related to issue Conf-16922.

I attach a screenshot of the error, and the PDF file that I try to get converted into an Confluence embedded file.
fields.summary: Viewfile of PDF fails: {viewfile:STEP Data Quality Product Brief - 2009 ENG-US.pdf\|width=400\|height=300}

fields.description:
The blog post macro won't render anything past 12/31/2009.

Steps to reproduce:
# Go to a personal space that has blog posts dating before 12/31/2009. (and has the blog-posts macro)
# Make a new post.
# Wait for an hour.
# Refresh the page.
# Notice that there are no posts after 12/31/2009 being rendered by the blog-posts macro.

Of course, you don't have to wait an hour: that step meant simply to illustrate that the error isn't because the user didn't wait long enough to refresh the page :).
fields.summary: Blog post macro won't render anything past 12/31/2009.
Have an option to disable uploading new profile pictures
Update JIRA and Confluence integration page

fields.description:
We had an interesting problem where padlock link for editing page permissions in view page mode ended working. After digging around we could narrow it down to this:

* Database contained group that was saved incorrectly by Confluence as "Me & amp; My Team" (without amp space) instead of correct version "Me & My Team"
** This was probably created by earlier version of Confluence, 3.0.2 most likely
** Cannot reproduce creation of incorrect name in database with version 3.1
* PermittedUserFinder.checkGroupExplicitlyPermitted threw NullPointerException which was probably caused by null group as our AD does not contain group with & amp;

Because of this problem padlock didn't open any dialog and there were errors in our log:

{code}
2010-01-04 15:13:09,824 ERROR [http-8443-15] [atlassian.confluence.servlet.ConfluenceServletDispatcher] sendError Could not execute action
 -- url: /pages/getpagepermissions.action | userName: myusername
java.lang.NullPointerException
        at com.atlassian.confluence.user.PermittedUserFinder.checkGroupExplicitlyPermitted(PermittedUserFinder.java:51)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.user.PermittedUserFinder.makeResult(PermittedUserFinder.java:43)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.actions.GetPagePermissionsAction.execute(GetPagePermissionsAction.java:84)
        at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.invoke(DefaultActionInvocation.java:168)
        at com.opensymphony.xwork.interceptor.AroundInterceptor.intercept(AroundInterceptor.java:35)
        at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.invoke(DefaultActionInvocation.java:165)

{code}
fields.summary: PermittedUserFinder.checkGroupExplicitlyPermitted throws NullPointerException when supplied group is null

fields.description:
A customer discovered that when Confluence failed to fetch some emails, Confluence still reports success.

Such emails fail to be imported due to {{javax.mail}} limitation as it is not able to parse an email header that does not follow [RFC-2183|http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2183.txt]:
{noformat}
2009-12-19 10:17:00,803 WARN [DefaultQuartzScheduler_Worker-2] [atlassian.confluence.mail.DefaultMailContentManager] storeIncomingMail Could not store mail message Expected ';', got ","
javax.mail.internet.ParseException: Expected ';', got ","
	at javax.mail.internet.ParameterList.<init>(ParameterList.java:281)
	at javax.mail.internet.ContentDisposition.<init>(ContentDisposition.java:100)
	at javax.mail.internet.MimeBodyPart.getDisposition(MimeBodyPart.java:1085)
	at javax.mail.internet.MimeBodyPart.getDisposition(MimeBodyPart.java:318)
	at com.atlassian.mail.MailUtils.getBodyFromMultipart(MailUtils.java:469)
{noformat}

See this [KB article|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Certain+mail+messages+fail+to+import].

Confluence should produce a more useful error message that says those emails fail to be fetched.
fields.summary: Create error message on failed mail import

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-18136].
  {panel}

Please add to known problem and advise users as to use caution when placing jar files in the *<WAS HOME>/lib/ext* folder in Websphere installation directory.

Websphere will load the jar file and use them in priority over Confluence library (or any other applications), which potentially causes library conflicts despite that application first class loader is selected.

Some documentations where this info can be included:
- http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Known+Issues+for+Websphere
- http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Websphere+6.x+Notes
fields.summary: Update Websphere documentation for Confluence (and JIRA)

fields.description:
Tested in Confluence 3.1.

When a page title or space title contains certain alphanumeric characters, for example something similar to below:
- "blah"
- blah"
- Michael & Vincent

Editing an attachment in Office will fail as the alphanumeric character is converted in the URL, for example:  
{noformat}
" or &
{noformat}

You may also see an error similar to below:
!Picture 1.png!

Note that Edit in Word _for the page itself_ works fine even when page title contains the character.
fields.summary: edit in office fail for attachments when page title contains certain alpha numeric characters

fields.description:
There are two situations. 

h3. Situation One
In our docs for [Configuring Server Base URL|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+the+Server+Base+URL], we note that the server base url must be the same as the one used to access confluence. 

However most likely no one will read this documentation, since its not exactly a complicated setting. So we need some sort of pop up warning message when setting this value, something like:

{quote}
Please note that the Server Base URL must be the same as the url used to access confluence, otherwise it can cause many issues. See [our Knowledge Base|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Various+issues+Caused+when+Server+Base+URL+does+not+Match+the+URL+used+to+access+Confluence] for further details
{quote}

We also need to spruce up our Help Tips to make this message more prominent 

!ServerBase.jpg!

If possible, we should also create some warning within the administration screen (or at the very least print to the log files), when users access confluence via a different URL, so administrators know they need to update the Server base URL. 

h3. Situation Two 
Since we don't validate the entry you can get errors 
{panel}
Steps to reproduce the issue:

1) Go to Administration > General Configuration > Edit and set your server base url to "localhost:8080" without the http:// in front

http://195.189.81.39:8080/confluence/
fields.summary: AJS Error - in latest version of Confluence.
Display slides like thumbnail gallery macro

fields.description:
The installations are totally different. And each of them works fine alone. 
No problems arise If I navigate between JIRA and Confluence, with the same navigator, in different servers (with different root domain).

But If I use the same web navigator to access them simultaneously (i.e Firefox) to log in JIRA (http://MyDomain.ip1.ip2.ip3:8080) and Confluence (http://MyDomain.ip1.ip2.ip3:8150), each time I make "log in" in One of them I get log out for the other. This occur also if I use separate windows for the same navigator.

But If I use different programs to navigate (for example, using firefox for JIRA and opera for Confluence) no problems arise and I can work logged in Jira and confluence at the same time.


Tested with  firefox 3.5 and opera 10.0
fields.summary: confluence logs out Jira and viceversa if are accessed with the same web navigator

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-18128].
  {panel}

I just noticed that this page is missing some of the versions that were released when the coherence licensing changed:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DEVNET/Confluence+Build+Information

Here are the versions that are missing and their build numbers:

||Version||Build Number||
| 2.9.3 | 1420 |
| 2.8.3 | 1326 |
| 2.7.4 | 1117 | 
| 2.6.3 | 919 |

These build numbers are required when restoring a space backup to a new version, and we now only make the versions above available.  Please update.
fields.summary: Update build documentation to include build versions for coherence updates...

fields.description:
The REST API currently responds only to a version number of "1" in the resource URL. It would be nice if we could use "latest" too.

For example, the following URL works:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/rest/prototype/1/content/208961579

But this one gives a 404:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/rest/prototype/latest/content/208961579

See the [REST API guidelines|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DEVNET/Atlassian+REST+API+Design+Guidelines+version+1#AtlassianRESTAPIDesignGuidelinesversion1-VersionControlforAPIs]. The guidelines say "If two or more versions are available, applications may provide a shortcut to the latest version using the {{latest}} key-word." So, we don't actually have two or more versions yet. But I was expecting to be able to use "latest" because I didn't want to bother to find out what the version number was. :)
fields.summary: REST API should recognise "latest" as a version in the resource URL

fields.description:
If you setup the urlrewrite.xml like so:

{noformat}
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<!DOCTYPE urlrewrite PUBLIC "-//tuckey.org//DTD UrlRewrite 2.6//EN" "http://tuckey.org/res/dtds/urlrewrite2.6.dtd">
<urlrewrite>
    <!-- For image references in CSS files --> 
    <rule>
      <from>^/s/(.*)/_/download/images/([^\?]*).*</from>
       <run class="com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.ResourceDownloadUtils" method="addPublicCachingHeaders" />
       <to type="forward">/images/$2</to>
   </rule>
    <rule>
	<from>^/s/(.*)/_/([^\?]*).*</from>
        <run class="com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.ResourceDownloadUtils" method="addPublicCachingHeaders" />
        <to type="forward">/$2</to>
    </rule>
	
<rule>
    <from>^/login.action</from>
    <condition type="scheme" operator="notequal">https</condition>
    <to type="redirect">https://localhost:8443/login.action</to>
    </rule>
 
    <rule>
    <from>^/dologin.action</from>
    <condition type="scheme" operator="notequal">https</condition>
    <to type="redirect">https://localhost:8443/dologin.action</to>
    </rule>

    <rule>
    <from>^/(.*)</from>
    <condition type="scheme" operator="equal">https</condition>
    <condition type="request-uri" operator="notequal">/login.action.*</condition>
    <condition type="request-uri" operator="notequal">/dologin.action.*</condition>	
    <condition type="request-uri" operator="notequal">/s/.*</condition>
    <to type="redirect">http://localhost:8080/$1</to>
    </rule>
</urlrewrite>
{noformat}

You are continually redirected to the login page.

It appears when redirecting https://localhost:8443/homepage.action to http://localhost:8080/homepage.action the session is invalidated.

h3. Atlassian Status 

All,

We have discussed the use of "HTTPS for login only" in a lot of detail. After looking at the various options, we have concluded that we will not be supporting this configuration in Confluence.

Although this configuration used to work in the past, in Confluence 3.0.2 we implemented a security improvement that helped prevent session fixation attacks (CONF-15108). The implications of this security feature meant that customers could no longer use HTTPS for login only. We did look at enabling this configuration again and concluded that we won't be doing so. There are several reasons for this. Many of these reasons have already been discussed in this post and the related issue ([CONF-4116|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-4116]).

The main customer feedback we have received on this issue primarily revolves around the use case of customers who wish to protect their LDAP credentials, but aren't as concerned about session hijacking.  Unfortunately, this is a *misconception* of the security provided by using HTTPS for login only.  If the "remember me" functionality is used - it is possible that anyone can intercept network traffic (after login) and can decrypt the users credentials. This is due to the way that the "remember me" functionality works.

It is due to this and all the [additional reasons |http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-4116?focusedCommentId=102037&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#action_102037] around the support of HTTPS for login only that we will not be implementing this feature.

We will continue work with you in making sure that the configuration you have setup is as secure as possible. Please don't hesitate to contact our [support team|http://support.atlassian.com] for assistance in this matter.

Sherif
Confluence Product Manager
fields.summary: Unable to use HTTPS for login only

fields.description:
Escaping characters inside of links works inconsistently. Some escapes work, while others do not.

* Using backslash right-square-bracket in the link alias section properly renders as a "]" in the link text on the page.
* Using backslash left-square-bracket in the link alias section breaks the link and displays the entire string as-is.
* Using backslash pipe in the link alias section is rendered as a "\" and erroneously uses the remainder of the alias as the linked page title
** and the actual linked page title as the tooltip, concat w/ the pipe-and-tooltip if present
* Using backslash right-square-bracket in the tooltip section will prevent the right-square-bracket from ending the link, but will render as a literal backslash right-square-bracket in the tooltip
* Using backslash left-square-bracket in the tooltip section will render as a literal backslash left-square-bracket
** and not attempting to escape the bracket will break the link and display as-is.
fields.summary: Inconsistent escaping within links

fields.description:
If you enter a title with extra (redundant) spaces when creating/editing a page, the extra spaces will be trimmed from the title when the saved page displays.
e.g.
# Create a page with the title "Bob is your  uncle"  _(note the extra space between "your" and "uncle")_
# Save the page.
# Copy and paste the title into a text editor, the text will be "Bob is your uncle", i.e. the extra space between "your" and "uncle" will be removed.

The scenario where this might be annoying is if you are trying to create a relative link to that page, by copying the page title and pasting it into your wiki markup as a link (as I was trying to do). I spent a while trying to figure out why my link was broken.
fields.summary: Extra spaces are removed from the page title when a page is saved

fields.description:
Currently, a template is basically the same as the resulting page except for a few form fields that can be collected and then reused.  All of the text presented on the template ends up in the final page.

At the very least, I should be able to specify text that appears on the template and not on the final page (to explain a field, for example).  Ideally, a template would have two parts: a form for collecting data and a page layout that gives the fixed content of the final page with the variables positioned to supply the variable content.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-18094].
  {panel}

Confluence won't work properly on Glassfish (v2.1 or v3) unless the classloader delegation is switched off. This can be configured via {{sun-web.xml}} which could be bundled with Confluence without affecting any other containers.

{code}
diff -r 39c81074bb98 confluence/confluence-project/conf-webapp/src/main/webapp/WEB-INF/sun-web.xml
--- /dev/null	Thu Jan 01 00:00:00 1970 +0000
+++ b/confluence/confluence-project/conf-webapp/src/main/webapp/WEB-INF/sun-web.xml	Sun Dec 20 09:28:16 2009 -0800
@@ -0,0 +1,9 @@
+<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
+
+<!DOCTYPE sun-web-app
+        PUBLIC "-//Sun Microsystems, Inc.//DTD Application Server 8.1 Servlet 2.4//EN"
+        "http://www.sun.com/software/appserver/dtds/sun-web-app_2_4-1.dtd">
+
+<sun-web-app error-url="">
+    <class-loader delegate="false"/>
+</sun-web-app>
{code}

Unless the classloader delegation if turned off, the container will try to use container's classloader to load classes before the application specific classloader is used. This will result in all kinds of weird errors in cases where same libraries but different versions are bundled with both Confluence and GlassFish (e.g. Felix, Xalan, etc).
fields.summary: Bundle sun-web.xml with classloader settings required for GlassFish (PATCH)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-18089].
  {panel}

I don't know how Confluence handles web requests under the covers, but some of our users have asked whether this feature exists in Confluence (we just moved from Trac).  I have since found that it doesn't.  In Trac, if you have a page hierarchy like so:

* Page1
** Page1Child
* Page2
** Page2Child
*** Page2ChildsChild

You could access Page 2 Child's Child like http://trac/Page2/Page2Child/Page2ChildsChild and Page 1's Child like http://trac/Page1/Page1Child and so on and so forth.  This is very user friendly because the URL actually means something to them.

However, in Confluence the page hierarchy as far as URLs is completely flat.  The major reason we want this is because we have multiple projects per space to cut down on the sheer number of spaces we would need.  For example, if we have test reports we'd like to be able to have multiple pages called 'Introduction' in the same space, as long as there wasn't already a page with that name under that *level* of the hierarchy (i.e. the same parent).  Having to name my page 'Project 1.4.6 Test Report Introduction' is a bit extreme, not to mention ugly when you export the page hierarchy to PDF for external consumption, as the table of contents is derived from the page titles.

Now that I think about it, this may be two feature requests...

# The ability to access a page using its hierarchy in the URL and
# The ability to have multiple pages of the same title in the same space, enforced by parentid.
fields.summary: Ability to access pages by hierarchy in the URL

fields.description: If you have the \{pagetreesearch\} macro in the default page location in Confluence 3.1 (at the bottom in a column next to the change history macro), when the page loads the autofocus causes the browser to jump to that location on the page.  It's easy to fix (either move the macro higher up in the page, or remove it altogether), but it's annoying because it will make its way on to every page we create unless we make a conscious effort to remove it.
fields.summary: Pages jump to bottom of page upon load (cause: {pagetreesearch})

Need an integrity checker to check all required database tables exist after an upgrade

fields.description:
Upon Confluence upgrade to 3.1 or later, admin may discover that the {{IMAGEDETAILS}} table does not exist.

An upgrade misconfiguration is known to can cause this. For example:
{panel}
# Admin created a test Confluence instance of the latest version and new database, then shut it down
# Admin imported production database into this new instance
# Admin copied production instance's Confluence Home but kept the test instance's {{confluence.cfg.xml}}
# Admin started test instance in the hope that this will upgrade Confluence
# Admin thought wrong! Because Confluence will see that the build number in {{confluence.cfg.xml}} is the same as the running Confluence version hence the upgrade is skipped.
{panel}

Step 3 is wrong. The {{confluence.cfg.xml}} should also be updated to reflect the correct build number ([click here|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DEVNET/Confluence+Build+Information] for Confluence Build Information).

{noformat:title=Sample error}
2009-12-10 10:57:14,019 ERROR [http-8085-30] [sf.hibernate.util.JDBCExceptionReporter] logExceptions Table 'confluence.IMAGEDETAILS' doesn't exist
 -- referer: http://yourconfluenceurl.com/display/SPACEKEY/PageTitle | url: /pages/removeattachment.action | userName: blah | action: removeattachment | page: 7799349
2009-12-10 10:57:14,022 ERROR [http-8085-30] [sf.hibernate.util.JDBCExceptionReporter] logExceptions Table 'confluence.IMAGEDETAILS' doesn't exist
 -- referer: http://yourconfluenceurl.com/display/SPACEKEY/PageTitle | url: /pages/removeattachment.action | userName: blah | action: removeattachment | page: 7799349
2009-12-10 10:57:14,025 ERROR [http-8085-30] [atlassian.confluence.event.ConfluenceEventManager] publishEvent An exception was encountered while processing the event: com.atlassian.confluence.event.events.content.attachment.AttachmentRemoveEvent[source=com.atlassian.confluence.pages.DefaultAttachmentManager@5a0d8695]
 -- referer: http://yourconfluenceurl.com/display/SPACEKEY/PageTitle | url: /pages/removeattachment.action | userName: blah | action: removeattachment | page: 7799349
org.springframework.jdbc.BadSqlGrammarException: Hibernate operation: Could not execute query; bad SQL grammar []; nested exception is com.mysql.jdbc.exceptions.jdbc4.MySQLSyntaxErrorException: Table 'confluence.IMAGEDETAILS' doesn't exist
Caused by: com.mysql.jdbc.exceptions.jdbc4.MySQLSyntaxErrorException: Table 'confluence.IMAGEDETAILS' doesn't exist
	at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance(NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.java:39)
{noformat}

This issue can be prevented had we have CONF-18085 implemented.

See also CONF-13798

Allow 'numero sign' to mark numbered list lines

fields.description:
We recommend users to set MySQL to create tables using InnoDB, however a customer may not wish to use InnoDB for tables created by other programs.

Suggestion is to specify Confluence to use InnoDB by default, this will avoid database issues on our end and will allow users to use other engines for other applications.
fields.summary: Create MySQL tables using InnoDB engine by default

fields.description:
In the common-editdecorator.vmd file there are closing 'table' and 'div' tags without corresponding opening tags. This can cause some problems when customising layouts.

Removing the redundant tags should resolve any mangled layouts. This is fixed in 3.1.
fields.summary: Redundant 'table' and 'div' tages in common-editdecorator.vmd file

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/User+Macros

fields.description:
The attachment drop box shows the english text "Drop files here to attach them". This text should be translated to the user's language.

Steps to reproduce:
# Set Confluence's language to german
# Open the page attachments

For german, a suitable translation would be: _"Dateien zum Anhängen hier ablegen"_
fields.summary: Attachment drop box text is not translated

fields.description:
On the attachments page, Firefox shows a useless scrollbar next to the attachment drop box when Confluence is run in german language. (Please see the attached screenshot for an example.) In Opera, the scrollbar is not displayed.

Steps to reproduce:
# Set global language to german
# open page attachments view

It seems related to the longer german text in the drop box which uses 3 lines instead of 2 lines for the english version.
fields.summary: Attachment drop box shows scrollbar in german localization

fields.description:
It would be so handy if clicking anywhere outside the 'Link to this Page' dialog closes the pop up.

Right now you either click the close button or press escape.
fields.summary: clicking outside the 'Link to this Page' dialog should also closes the pop up

fields.description:
Editing a comment with any of the characters {{"}}, {{'}}, and {{&}} in wiki markup puts equivalent HTML entities (", ', &) into the edit box instead of the character itself. Hitting save on the edit box then saves the text with the HTML entities in place.

Changing to the rich text editor replaces the entities with their character equivalent. Switching back to wiki markup keeps the characters rather than the entities.

This happens on the Left Navigation theme but not on the default theme.
fields.summary: Editing a comment in markup mode inserts HTML entities
